article.headline: West Virginia 74, James Madison 57
article.story: HARRISONBURG, Va. (AP) -- Drew Schifino scored 27 points, including eight in the final five minutes on Monday, to lead West Virginia to a 74-57 victory over James Madison. The Mountaineers (1-0) hit five 3-pointers during a 17-2 run, including two each from Kevin Pittsnogle and Patrick Beilein, to put West Virginia on top 23-6 with 12:15 left in the first half. Tyrone Sally made a 3-pointer to cap a 12-6 run with 58 seconds to play in the first half for West Virginia, which led 40-22 at halftime. The Dukes (1-1) cut the Mountaineers' 15-point lead to 62-53 on a Dwayne Browles free throw with 4:31 remaining in the game. D'or Fischer scored 14 points off the bench for West Virginia. Beilein and Tyler Relph added 10 points. Browles led the Dukes with 20 points, including 9-11 from the free throw line. Chris Cathlin grabbed 12 rebounds. The Mountaineers made 48 percent of their shots, including nine of 20 from behind the 3-point line. The Dukes shot 31 percent and were 13 percent 3-point range.
